timeline.message:
Added API for delegated drop adapters - (Task #74)

- Added drop adapter to navigator which is capable of redirecting drag
and drop operations to different drop handlers.
- Added extension point to register new drop adapters for individual
concepts.

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

Added Empty Implementation for PS Drop Adapter - (Task #74)

- Added concept specific dropa dapter to Product structure model
extension

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/development' into feature/task_74-Override_DND_functiona

Implemented first Product Structure related dropAdapter - (Task #74)

- Renamed extension point schema.
- Fixed code to load delegation drop adapter from registration
- Implemented first drop adapter to replace typing of a given
structuralelementinstance.

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

Refactored Command Checks - (Task #74)

- Now checking if object can be inherited from, otherwise a command will
be set to be unexecutable.

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

Added test case for inheritance case - (Task #74)

- Added test case to test that the applicability check is correct when
using the inheritance feature
- Renamed test cases to distinguish between the cases: adding child seis
or adding super seis.

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

moved implementation for typing to project - (Task #74)

- Inheritance is in general an extension independant functionality,
therefore it has been moved to project.
- will implement PS specific inheritance drop to also create new
elements.

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator
Merge branch 'feature/task_74-Override_DND_functiona' of https://github.com/virtualsatellite/VirtualSatellite4-Core.git into feature/task_74-Override_DND_functiona

Implemented all functionality for PS drag and drop - (Task #74)

- Added functionality to create new PS element when pressing ALT with
DND operation.
- Also adjusting discipline and names when creating drop.

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

Cleaned up code - (Task #74)

- Removed all warnings
- Prepared test cases

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

Write a Heading here - (Task #74)

- Added further hamcrest dependency to test plugin so that the
hamcrest.collections matchers are available.
- Implemented test cases for VirSatInheritance Drop Adapter

---
Task #74: Override DND functionality in Navigator

timeline.bodyText: Is this really just an info and not an error?
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: Well a WARNING could be ok, ERROR I think should indicate a problem that may create havoc when further executing the application. WARNING is more like something went unexpectedly wrong but is regarded as no critical problem.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: The first with can be removed
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText: I think we should also pass the stack trace to the logger.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: Yes added it to the places where INFOs are now logged as WARNINGS
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: I think we can make these private.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: arent they automatically private if not explicitly stated?
replies.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText:
The visibility level if not stated is considered "package protected". E.g. classes in the same package can access the variables. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/accesscontrol.html
This has the minor consequence that eclipse doesnt create warnings for unused variables. So if, for example due to a change in the test case, the variable ed is no longer used, then eclipse would not create a warning. And the dead variable would just lie around.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: ok, than i add it to the change.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Maybe a short comment why its overwritten.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: PhilMFischer

replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText:
I guess this Store class is introduced to avoid the effectivly final requirement since you want to save the result from the doExecute call?
You may disagree, but I would prefer using final List<T> objects = new ArrayList<>(); and then objects.add(supplier.get()) simple since it avoids introducing some new magic class.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: Decided to go with a vector
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: Shall we maybe rename "validatedDragObjects" into just "dragObjects"? Or where are they validated?
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText: Not a hundred percent sure if i ilke to name it differently, because for me it were the objects which were ok when the validateDrop method executed. Nevertheless, they are not necessarily valid. I changed them now to dropEObject and dragObjects
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Eclipse formatter wouldn't have liked it 😄
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText: Yes, i am not happy with it either. The way it is written it is readable, autoformatting will fail big time. Is there a good way we could adjust our formatting?
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText:
I am wondering, does eclipse guarantee to have the same class instance process validate and handle without interference of other DND operations? (in this case we can just save the command and remove this if, and other fields).
Anyhow, is command creation so expensive that we want to cache it? Or does it have side effects? Let's maybe create the command again and simplify the whole class?
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to set the selection to drop target?
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: I suggest we move the selection setting to its own method
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to init copy-paste adapter, but not inheritance?
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: Let's move this to the top to the other fields
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: Let's rename it to something like getConceptSpecificDropAdapter
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: This shoud be named somehow like DelegatedDropAdapterAssistant
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText: To me it looks like this class mostly repeats platform code. Can't we just use the normal navigator dropassistant extension point from concepts? We can make them higher priority to be sure they act before the default ones
replies.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText:
This shoud be named somehow like DelegatedDropAdapterAssistant

Done.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText:
To me it looks like this class mostly repeats platform code. Can't we just use the normal navigator dropassistant extension point from concepts? We can make them higher priority to be sure they act before the default ones

Unfortunately no. From what i saw, we can only add dropAdapter to navigator content contributions. Therefore every concept may have to provide a complete navigator content. Not a 100% sure, but i also think that it is only possible to add one dropAdapter per navigatorContent.
The way it is implemented now, it is possible to define a dropAdapter which can be used in any navigator but it can also be reused in the delegateDropAdapter.
I think this increases functionality and flexibility on what developers want to do on concept side.
replies.author: PhilMFischer

timeline.bodyText: Also not clear to me why this class is also appears in the plugin.xml of calculation.ui
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText: Good question! @SaMuellerDLR  Do we need the drop adapter there? I think it is heritage and we should leave it there for the moment. But i guess we don't need it , since we do not have any code dealing with Copy&Paste and DnD of Equations. Do we?
replies.author: PhilMFischer

replies.bodyText:
I checked it yesterday and we dont have any drag and drop functionality for equations.
I found the commit in our old repository, and there it looks like the entry only exists due to creating the setup with copy & paste. I think it can be safely removed.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: I removed it from calculations
replies.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText: Unnecessary comment
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

timeline.bodyText:
Let's maybe also check the number of child items after DND?
Also can we emulate add and override actions?
timeline.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText:
Well, we could check for the children, but i think that is covered by the unit tests we added. This test i just implemented to have a rough overview that the registration on the extension point and execution of the dropAdapter works as expected.
Unfortunately SWTBot only supports The DragAndDrop Move at the moment. Changing it looks to me like a modification in SWTBot code.
replies.author: PhilMFischer
